replies.body: Revive...

Yeah its real rewarding giving some one like that a win. /s

I know from experience. 

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2110786538/202495372
What am I supposed to see here? Looks normal enough to me.

That 2/14 AP Gangplank doe. 

Really glad me and my ADC gave him a win for that performance.

Thought he was trying a new build or  having a bad game or something. Normals are well, normals. I'm more serious on my smurf than my main cuz my main has broken MMR cuz losing games during early levels(pre-30) and now get meh teammates.

There is absolutely nothing AP Gangplank offers. And you don't go 2/14 just "trying a new build in normals." It also helps that in the game he told one of my team mates no when he was asked to stop playing aggressively.

It happens dude.  I'm Plat and sometimes the enemy team is just determined to shit stomp you personally and your team isn't gonna do a thing to stop it.

2/14 is a *bad game*   0/103/0 is Intentional feeding.

2/14 on an AD Gangplank is a bad game. 2/14 on an AP Gangplank is intentional feeding. He gets a stronger self heal and magic damage on his ult. That helps no one.  There comes a time, long before 14 deaths that you realize this build does nothing in lane or team fights.  There also comes a time, again long before 14 deaths, that you realize that you aren't doing anything other than dying.

It's a normal.

My last Renekton game (ranked) I went 2/12/7

The Fiora, Udyr, TF combo for diving and ripping me apart was *real*, shit happens, you can die regardless of your build if the enemy is determined enough to put enough resources to you.

One person was putting in resources to stop him, his laning opponent. I don't even know why you are making up shit about the game when you have the actual match history. You can see by selecting Elise that almost everyone of her kills are in the top lane. Coincidentally most of Gangplanks deaths are in the same area.  

 She constalnly killed him in lane because he would pick fights with her with a useless AP build. He wouldn't play safe if asked too, that the definition of intentional feeding.

I never had some one tell me what happened in my own game. Especially when the first thing i did is provide the match history. 

There was no team that was putting in a lot of resources into shutting him down. He built a useless build and tried to 1v1 the top laner non stop, dying countless times. As you can see by the match history I provieded it backs up this claim. 10 of his 14 deaths are in the top lane, which is also where Elise got most of her kills. 

He literally built a bad build and constantly died to 1v1's he shouldn't be picking, then when asked to stop said no. That intentional feeding.

people like you are why the koreans always beat us to the op shit. people that don't let people try the stupid shit until they find the perfect mix of fuck you to win the game with.

Don't be that person, you don't need to be on the cutting edge of innovation, but don't be the guy that decides it's always a bad idea.
*shrug*
Where did you find this dinosaur?
It's a classic from the old forums. I'm just bringing it here to the boards to keep it immortal.

>
> It's a classic from the old forums. I'm just bringing it here to the boards to keep it immortal.

It's also my favorite response to the "everything is viable" crap.
I just lost because a tf afk'd, then came back and fed his ass off. I now feel inspired to carry the next troll. This was probably a sign from the League gods. Cheers mate
How on earth is that even possible?? To get this stat line, he must've ran straight into the enemy fountain everytime as soon as he revived..
He didn't run. He rolled.
That's a pro as heck build
Some people are lucky. Getting carried in games the have no right to be winning.
That's some next level feeding.

He's banned now btw.
But the legends of his hard carrying continues.
I wanna see the game from the picture in OP FK
